. Noordwijk divides into two parts, Noordwijk aan  Zee (the old fishing settlement, and now more touristy and with good shopping)on the dunes, and Noordwijk Binnen (the older, historic village) slightly further in land.
Centraal Station. From the bus platform at the train station take bus 20 or 21 to Noordwijk (aan Zee).
As with all small towns in Holland, a bike is by far the best way to get around.

value: in Noordwijk Binnen, particularly clustered around the Voorstraat and the two large churches.

, one of the best in this part of Holland. Make sure you take time to head into one of the beach pavilions at the end of the day and grab a drink. These pavilions are every 500m and are disassembled in the winter.
content=Think twice about getting a starterdish! Big meals for a good price.

content=The best ice cream in town. So good that locals even c ome here after dinner at home. Buy an ice cream, sit on one of the benches outside and watch the good and great come past. Had a very large selection of flavours.
content=Nice small bar with lot's of different locals around! Be sure to try the Korenwolf draught beer.
content=Friendly family-run hotel. Makes a pleasant change from all the business hotels.
